(Simplified: 鹉)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 武 indicates the sound; 鳥 (bird) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 武 [ wǔ ] military; martial, warlike
    • 鳥 [ niǎo ] bird
①見“鸚鵡”(yīngwǔ)。鳥名。

鵡字的基本解释

鵡
wǔ
见“鹉”。

鵡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wǔ］
［《廣韻》文甫切，上麌，微。］
“鹉1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
见“鸚鵡”。

鵡字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鵡； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1491第08
【廣韻】文甫切【集韻】【韻會】罔甫切，?音武。鸚鵡，能言鳥也。【禮·曲禮】鸚鵡能言，不離飛鳥。【郭璞云】靑羽赤喙，舌似小兒，有五色者，白者，赤者。凡鳥四指，三指向前一向後。此鳥兩指向後。【禽經】鸚鵡拊其背而啞。【正字通】與䳇同。

暂无。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Bird Character Department] 　 Wu; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 1491 Page 08
[Guang Yun] Wen Fu Cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Were Fu cut,? Yin Wu. Parrots can speak birds. [Li·Liqu Li] Parrots can speak, but they can't leave the birds. [Guo Puyun] The feathers have a red beak, and the tongue is like a child. There are five colors, white and red. Fanniao has four fingers, three points forward and one backward. The bird points backwards. 【Qing Jing】The parrot stretches its back and is dumb. 【Zhengzitong】Same as Bahai.
